intro: Alyxia pagonensis, commonly known as the Pagona alyxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and other ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. Alyxia pagonensis typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland areas. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
